intro: Agathosma eriantha, commonly known as the Cape geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, aromatic leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to mild, temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts due to its ornamental value and ecological significance.
